title: Ticket #5577: RunningJobs and FlockedJobs in submitter ads are messed up
description:
The Running/FlockedJobs attributes in the submitter ads in v8.5.3 running now in CHTC seem to be messed up. Check out the below - I picked one user at random (jlange3) that is running jobs in CHTC and flocking to DoIT. He is submitting just from one submit host (submit-4). He only has vanilla jobs. Most of his claims have been active for hours.

His CHTC submitter ad claims he is running 1325 jobs in CHTC, but he is really only running 196. His CHTC submitter ad claims he is running 575 jobs via flocking, but he is really running 1600 jobs at DoIT.

Seems like how it assigns between RunningJobs and FlockedJobs is completely borked. Then looking at his submitter ad in the DoIT pool, the numbers appear swapped.

FWIW, condor_q agrees with the numbers that condor_status is reporting, and doing a condor_status -direct for the submitter ad doesn't change anything. 

tannenba@cm ~]$ condor_status -pool cm.chtc.wisc.edu -submit -cons 'name=="jlange3@chtc.wisc.edu"' -af:l RunningJobs FlockedJobs JobsRunning
RunningJobs = 1325 FlockedJobs = 575 JobsRunning = 1902

[tannenba@cm ~]$ condor_status -pool condor1.doit.wisc.edu -submit -cons 'name=="jlange3@chtc.wisc.edu"' -af:l RunningJobs FlockedJobs JobsRunning
RunningJobs = 189 FlockedJobs = 1711 JobsRunning = 0

[tannenba@cm ~]$ condor_status -pool cm.chtc.wisc.edu -cons 'remoteuser=?="jlange3@chtc.wisc.edu"' -af true | wc -l
196

[tannenba@cm ~]$ condor_status -pool condor1.doit.wisc.edu -cons 'remoteuser=?="jlange3@chtc.wisc.edu"' -af true | wc -l
1600
remarks:
2016-Mar-23 15:55:49 by tannenba:
Perhaps unrelated, but of note: submit-4 has configured a non-default value of 10 for FLOCK_INCREMENT knob

2016-Mar-23 16:54:36 by tannenba:
Clue!!! Looks like many jobs do not have attribute RemotePool defined, and this attribute is used when the schedd restarts in order to fill in the "pool" field of the match record, which in turn is used for the counts in the submitter ad.

So if we can figure out how flocked jobs ended up with RemotePool undefined, we can solve the problem.

2016-Mar-24 15:12:18 by jfrey:
The problem is that the pool name is being lost when doing claim-partitionable-leftovers. In Scheduler::claimedStartd(), when a ScheddNegotiate object is made to claim the leftovers ad, a NULL is always given for the pool name.

2016-Mar-24 15:44:58 by tannenba:
Code Review

Patch looks good, resolving.
